definitions.text: a row or line of people (especially soldiers or police) standing abreast of one another
examples: the entrance was guarded by ranks of policemen
his salary was determined by his rank and seniority

definitions.text: the ordinary members of an organization (such as the enlisted soldiers of an army)
examples: the strike was supported by the union rank and file
he rose from the ranks to become a colonel
the British are more aware of social status than Americans are

definitions.text: the body of members of an organization or group
examples: they found dissension in their own ranks
he joined the ranks of the unemployed

definitions.text: take or have a position relative to others
examples: This painting ranks among the best in the Western World

definitions.text: assign a rank or rating to
examples: how would you rank these students?
The restaurant is rated highly in the food guide

definitions.text: take precedence or surpass others in rank
very offensive in smell or taste
conspicuously and outrageously bad or reprehensible
complete and without restriction or qualification; sometimes used informally as intensifiers
examples: got the job through sheer persistence
